alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 11:12AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Idaho, including the following county, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1059 AM MDT, local law enforcement and transportation officials reported minor flooding due to snowmelt continues across the advisory area, both in Preston and in other locations across the county. In addition, periodic flooding is occurring on US-91 in the area of the Bear River and Battle Creek, north of Preston. - Cooler temperatures over the next several days may slow down snowmelt and runoff, but minor flooding and high water in creeks, streams, and ditches is likely to continue. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Preston, Franklin, Oneida Narrows Reservoir, Thatcher, Dayton, Weston, Clifton, Oxford, Riverdale, Mink Creek, Whitney, Mapleton and Emmigrant Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to the National Weather Service office in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, when you can do so safely.
